title: Hibachi
excerpt: Went out to a hibachi place
html:
I forgot I was trying to post something everyday. We went to a Japanese steakhouse today.

Tomorrow I’m flying back to the San Francisco Bay area, so you’ll probably get another aerial shot.

My dad makes calendars each year as Christmas presents for our extended family. He includes everyone’s birthdays and anniversaries. There hasn’t been a new version of the calender creator software in a while, and I thought I might be able to create someing that works better. I’ll add that to my list of coding projects to do.

relatedPosts.title: Tikka
relatedPosts.excerpt: I tried the meatballs and tikka masala.
relatedPosts.html: I tried the meatballs and tikka masala. It was pretty good. A quick meal. I just microwaved the meatballs for a couple minutes to thaw, then I added some sauce and microwaved another couple of minutes.

relatedPosts.title: Regional
relatedPosts.excerpt: Have you heard of cheese dip?
relatedPosts.html:
I made cheese dip tonight. No meat again.

I’m not sure if it’s a family recipe or regional. It’s creamcheese, a little milk, worcestershire sauce, Lawry’s seasoned salt, and diced vidalia onions. It’s best with plain potato chips, but good with Ritz, pretzels, and any other chips.

relatedPosts.title: Meatballs
relatedPosts.html:
I just had an idea for dinner tonight.

We have a giant bag of meatballs from Costco. I often have them as a snack - mixed with some homemade barbecue sauce. I also have a jar of tikka masala. I think that might make a good sauce. Oh, I just remembered it’s Ash Wednesday, so I can’t eat meatballs. Maybe tomorrow.
